articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Congress was scrambling to avert a partial government shutdown on Friday, hours after more than three dozen Republicans rejected a demand by President-elect Donald Trump to use the measure to lift the nation's debt ceiling.
articles.title: US Congress scrambles to try to avert looming shutdown after Trump demand rejected

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A car ploughed into a group of people at a Christmas market in the eastern German town of Magdeburg, broadcaster MDR and other local media said on Friday citing a local government official.
articles.title: Car ploughs into Christmas market in eastern German town, media reports say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes killed at least 25 Palestinians in the Gaza Strip on Friday, medics said, including at least eight in an apartment in the Nuseirat refugee camp and at least ten in the town of Jabalia.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes kill at least 25 Palestinians round Gaza, medics say

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Friday looked set to lose power early next year after a key ally said he would move to bring down the minority Liberal government and trigger an election.
articles.title: Justin Trudeau looks set to lose power after key ally vows to topple him

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Top diplomats from the Biden administration are in Damascus on Friday to meet new Syrian authorities led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), a State Department spokesperson said, the first in-person and official meeting between Washington and Syria's de-facto new rulers.
articles.title: Top US officials in Damascus to meet new Syrian rulers, State Department says

articles.author: Wladimir Pantaleone, Angelo Amante
articles.description: A court on Friday acquitted Italian Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini of charges of kidnapping over 100 migrants aboard a boat he had blocked at sea for nearly three weeks in 2019, as part of a policy to curb irregular arrivals.
articles.title: Italian deputy PM Salvini acquitted of migrant kidnapping charges

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council on Friday extended a long-running peacekeeping mission between Syria and the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights for six months and expressed concern that military activities in the area could escalate tensions.
articles.title: UN extends peacekeeping mission between Syria, Israeli-occupied Golan Heights

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two U.S. senators introduced bipartisan legislation on Friday that would impose sanctions on Turkey, citing concerns over military action by that country or groups that it backs, in northern Syria.
articles.title: US senators seek Turkey sanctions, citing military action in Syria

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: El Salvador violated a woman's rights after denying her an abortion in 2013 despite doctors' calls to terminate her high-risk pregnancy, the Inter-American Court of Human Rights said on Friday.
articles.title: El Salvador violated woman's rights in high-stakes abortion case, human rights court rules

articles.author: Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron was due on Friday to visit shantytowns in Mayotte ravaged by Cyclone Chido on the second day of a visit where he has faced calls to speed up relief to the Indian Ocean archipelago.
articles.title: France's Macron to visit Mayotte shantytowns wrecked by Cyclone Chido
